full_summary:
### KIX Knowledge Synthesis Scoping Study on Teacher Professional Development [Expired]

The International Development Research Centre (IDRC) is seeking proposals for a Consultant to conduct a knowledge synthesis study on Teacher Professional Development (TPD) as part of the Global Partnership for Education Knowledge & Innovation Exchange (KIX).

The study is expected to draw from existing KIX projects as well as two recent IDRC-funded projects on scaling TPD. Key objectives of the study include:

*    Conduct an in-depth analysis and synthesis of existing research and program data related to TPD within the context of Global Partnership for Education (GPE) member countries
*    Identify knowledge gaps, opportunities, and challenges related to TPD, and
*    Provide recommendations for future research, policy, and programming based on the synthesis of existing research and findings

**Contract Details**

*   Contracting Entity: International Development Research Centre
*   Contact: Lindsay Empey (empey@idrc.ca)
*   Tender URL: None
*   Attachment: KIX Knowledge Synthesis Scoping Study on Teacher Professional Development [PDF]
*   Tender Expiration Date: February 21, 2023, 1:00 PM EST
*   Geographic Region: Canada
*   Contract Type: Request for Proposal

**Tender Brief**

The Consultant will be responsible for conducting a comprehensive review of existing literature and research on TPD within the context of Global Partnership for Education (GPE) member countries, and developing a knowledge synthesis report outlining key findings, recommendations, and policy implications.

[Download the Request for Proposal document from the Canadabuy link above for additional information.](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2023/02/03/b69a86992adf1f12ee0f162625d4f3d1/rfp22230018_kix_knowledge_synthesis_scoping_study_on_teacher_professional_development.pdf)

[End of Reddit Entry]
### 

**Conclusion**

By leveraging existing knowledge and research on TPD, this initiative aims to optimize the development of teacher support systems in GPE member countries, ultimately contributing to desired educational outcomes.
